bit of spelling correction in the dark angels description
Date maintenance tags and general fixes
Change deprecated template to its successor. using [[Project:AutoWikiBrowser|AWB]]
German Space Marine link deleted, because it´s about the W40K tabletop game Space Marine, not the W40K soldiers.
Removed irrelevent mention of Soul Drinkers from 'Lost Legions & Primarchs' section.
Disambiguate [[Native Americans]] to [[Indigenous peoples of the Americas]] using [[:en:Wikipedia:Tools/Navigation_popups|popups]]
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/66.188.56.2|66.188.56.2]] to last revision by The Stealth Ranger ([[WP:HG|HG]])
/* Traitor Legions */ use British English spelling
/* Computer games */ rm "Warhammer 40,000" prefix from the last 2 games, like the other 5
/* Appearance */ "power armour" isn't capitalised in the codex, so don't here
Revert to revision 303196383 dated 2009-07-20 20:16:46 by 91.3.217.199 using [[:en:Wikipedia:Tools/Navigation_popups|popups]]
/* The Horus Heresy */ The link returned to this same page, without an explanation of the term.
/* The Great Crusade */ The link returned to this same page, without an explanation of the term.
/* The Horus Heresy */ He retired to consolidate not to rest
/* Playing style */Date maintenance tags and general fixes
/* Criticism */ Deleted, it has absolutely no basis on the article and does not do anything but complain.
revert, article is written in British English. tag section
/* Criticism */Date maintenance tags and general fixes
rv, of dubious encyclopedic value at this stage
Removed reference to Thermopylae - one similarity does not an equivalence make. Fictional battle lacks heroic sacrifice, imperial domination by aggressors, East-West conflict and Gerard Butler.
rv. we use the common name by default. articles are not written from the perspective of the game universe
Changed instances of "Space Marine" and "Marine" to "Astartes"
provided example of Thermopylae, and changed 'vanilla' to "standard"
fix ISBN syntax ([[Wikipedia:WikiProject Check Wikipedia|Wikipedia Check Wikipedia]] check #69; fmt
Expanded Legion backgrounds, fixed spelling errors, added details of Chapter Organisation and divided article into pre- and post-Heresy
Changed description of codex image from 5th to 4th
/* Fictional history */ Cut down some of the Legion entries to about the same length.
The influences are covered in the individual Legion descriptions already. Historical influences incorporated into the Supersoldier archetype are not uncommon, particularly with Knight and Romans.
Not related to fiction, or primarily speculative. No need for a list of the Horus Heresy books, as they do not all involve Marines, and there are other books that do.
/* Fictional history */ The Vikings were not a civilization. Many small style and content edits. Too much padding in sentences.
rv. edits lowered the quality of the lede
/* "Lost" Legions & Primarchs */ Correct caps in section header.
Robot-assisted fix [[WP:DPL|links to disambiguation page]] Roman
/* Fictional history */ removed false information added about the supposed "MXIV legion"

Removing "3commandants.jpg", it has been deleted from Commons by [[commons:User:Polarlys|Polarlys]] because: [[commons:Commons:Derivative works]]: copyright violation, it depicts a copyrighted work which is not published under a free license]].
/* Fictional history */ Edit to Salamanders entry (capitalisation and wikilink to scarification)
Date maintenance tags and general fixes
/* "Lost" Legions & Primarchs */ Really minor: added full stop!
/* Traitor legions */ Luna Wolves / Word Bearers / Alpha Legion spelling & punctuation
actually, Space Marine was renamed Epic (well, "Epic 40,000" first, then "Epic") the better part of 15 years ago
the name of the game with Titans and tiny figs is ''Space Marine'', not ''Epic''
/* Space Marines in Warhammer 40,000 fiction */ copy edit
copy edit, removed editorial opining, caps fix, and tag for source of claim
/* Later Foundings */ Correct caps in section header.
/* Later Foundings */ Correct caps in section header.
/* Later Foundings */ Correct caps in section header.
[[WP:AWB/T|Typo fixing]], typos fixed: thier → their using [[Project:AutoWikiBrowser|AWB]]
/* Loyalists */ removed Black templars from the loyalist legion list as the black templars are not a found ing legion, but one of the second founding chapters.
